create.title: Creating a Country Dossier
create.description: See how a diplomat creates a comprehensive country dossier in under a minute.

transcript.0: Welcome to this quick tutorial on creating a country dossier.
transcript.1: First, click the 'Create Dossier' button in the top right corner.
transcript.2: Select 'Country' as the dossier type, then choose the country from the dropdown list.
transcript.3: Add key details like bilateral relationship status and priority level. Click 'Create' to finish.

linkBrief.title: Linking Briefs to Engagements
linkBrief.description: Learn how policy analysts connect briefing documents to international engagements.

transcript.0: This tutorial shows you how to link briefs to engagements for better context.
transcript.1: Open an engagement and navigate to the 'Related Documents' tab.
transcript.2: Click 'Link Brief' and select from existing briefs or generate a new one.
transcript.3: The linked brief will now appear in your engagement summary for quick reference.

track.title: Tracking Commitments
track.description: Follow up on promises and deliverables from meetings and events.

transcript.0: Commitments help you track promises made during engagements.
transcript.1: After creating an after-action record, commitments are automatically extracted.
transcript.2: View all commitments in the 'My Work' dashboard and filter by status.
transcript.3: Update commitment status as you make progress to keep stakeholders informed.

upload.title: Uploading Documents
upload.description: Quick guide to uploading and organizing documents in the system.

transcript.0: Uploading documents is simple and keeps your files organized.
transcript.1: Click 'Upload Document' and drag files or browse your computer.
transcript.2: Add tags and link to relevant dossiers for easy discovery.
transcript.3: Your documents are now searchable and linked to your dossiers.

manage.title: Managing Organizations
manage.description: Add and link international organizations to your dossiers.

transcript.0: Organizations represent the entities you work with internationally.
transcript.1: Create an organization by clicking 'Add Organization' and entering details.
transcript.2: Link organizations to dossiers and track your engagement history.
transcript.3: View all interactions with an organization in one consolidated timeline.

portfolio.title: Building Your Country Portfolio
portfolio.description: How diplomats organize and track countries in their portfolio.

transcript.0: Your country portfolio is the hub for all bilateral relationships.
transcript.1: Add countries you're responsible for and set their priority levels.
transcript.2: Each country gets a dedicated dossier with MOUs, engagements, and contacts.
transcript.3: Use the dashboard to see upcoming deadlines and relationship health scores.

trackRenewals.title: Tracking MOU Renewals
trackRenewals.description: Never miss an MOU expiration with automated renewal tracking.

transcript.0: MOUs require careful tracking to ensure timely renewals.
transcript.1: Add an MOU with its expiration date and the system will track it.
transcript.2: You'll receive notifications as the expiration date approaches.
transcript.3: Update the status as negotiations progress to keep everyone informed.

network.title: Visualizing the Relationship Network
network.description: Explore connections between countries, organizations, and topics.

transcript.0: The relationship network shows how entities are connected.
transcript.1: Navigate to the Network Graph view from any dossier.
transcript.2: Zoom and pan to explore connections. Click nodes for details.
transcript.3: Use filters to focus on specific relationship types or time periods.
